item.title: 3.1: Voting I: Preference Aggregation & Cycling
item.description: Contents Appendix: Spatial Competition in Multiple-Dimensions Appendix: Spatial Competition in Multiple-Dimensions In class, we looked at spatial competition along a single dimension, and saw that if preferences are single-peaked, the median platform will win a majority, and escape the problem of cycling. Suppose we have three voters again voting on a platform of two issues: (1) Education Spending and (2) Defense Spending.
